subject: Re: boilerplate for testEquals, testCompareTo, testHashCo de wanted
msgSnippet: ... It would be better to have user passed objects, that way you could run the tests on various values - ones near boundaries, and so as per a normal testing
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., Daniel Barclay <dbarclay@m...> wrote:
> > From: ccbarham [mailto:cbarham@p...]
> > I believe that ideally these 'standard' tests would prove, (for any
> > object named x y and z):
> > equals():
> > 1. x.equals(x) returns true
> > 2. x.equals(y) returns true if y.equals(x)
> > ...
> For which values of x and y? You can't test everything.
>
> Or do you mean a test suite to which you pass a set of values
> from which to select x, y, etc.?

It would be better to have user passed objects, that way you could run
the tests on various values - ones near boundaries, and so as per a
normal testing strategy. I wouldn't imagine having to work up test
involving various permutations of null parameters - these can be
written into the test.

I'm just looking into the GSBASE package and it's equals test class on
sourceforge, as suggested earlier in this thread, to see how it was
achieved. It looks as thought the parameter passing works fin in there....
